required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long Term Outcome of Combined Phacoemulsification and Excisional Goniotomy With the Kahook Dual Blade
clinical_study.official_title: Long Term Outcome of Combined Phacoemulsification and Excisional Goniotomy With the Kahook Dual Blade

brief_summary.textblock:
Purpose: Characterize changes in intraocular pressure (IOP), IOP-lowering medications, and visual acuity (VA) through 3 years in patients undergoing combined phacoemulsification and excisional goniotomy with the Kahook Dual Blade (phaco-KDB), with simultaneous goniosynechialysis in cases of angle-closure glaucoma, by a single surgeon (A.H.) in King Fahd Hospital of the University, Dammam, Saudi Arabia.
Methods: Prospective, non-comparative, uncontrolled, non-randomized interventional case series. Consecutive patients with medically-treated glaucoma and visually-significant cataract underwent combined surgery. Subgroup analysis of glaucoma subtypes was performed.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Prospective, non-comparative, uncontrolled, non-randomized interventional case series. Consecutive patients with medically-treated glaucoma and visually-significant cataract underwent combined surgery. Subgroup analysis of glaucoma subtypes was performed.

primary_outcome.description: Characterize changes in intraocular pressure (IOP) in mmHg goldmann applanation tonometry each visit in the clinic after the combined phacoemulsification and excisional goniotomy with the kahook dual blade.
count the change in number of Intraocular pressure lowering medications each visit in the clinic after the combined phacoemulsification and excisional goniotomy with the kahook dual blade

secondary_outcome.description: Characterize visual acuity (VA) using logMAR chart, each visit in clinic post undergoing combined phacoemulsification and excisional goniotomy with the kahook dual blade.

arm_group.description: Prospective, non-comparative, uncontrolled, non-randomized interventional case series. Consecutive patients with medically-treated glaucoma and visually-significant cataract underwent combined surgery. Subgroup analysis of glaucoma subtypes was performed.

intervention.description: Combined Phacoemulsification and Excisional Goniotomy with the Kahook Dual Blade

criteria.textblock:
inclusion criteria:
- adults 18 years or older
- medically-managed glaucoma
- visually significant cataract
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing any other combined procedures
- active uveitis
- coexisting retinopathy that limits visual acuity potential
- active neovascularization
- angle dysgenesis
- those with less than 6 months of follow-up, were excluded.

facility.name: Imam Abdulrahman Bin Faisal University Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_title: Dr. Ahmed Al Habash, MD assistant professor, consultant cataract and glaucoma
